description: This refers to an employee who is engaged in accounting duties, handling and receipting money under supervision.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for taking care of doctors' appointments and maintains all clinical records.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for processing the admission of patients in a hospital and handles cash paid by patients or relatives and allocates beds in a ward, files and deals with confidential matters concerning patients
This refers to an employee who issues invoices/bills to patients for items used during procedures or on discharge from the hospital.
This refers to an employee who oversees and manages the daily operations of a medical facility or clinic.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for receiving statements and arranging the payments of creditors
This refers to an employee who is responsible for feeding or punching information into a computer.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for receiving, checking and posting of creditors or debtors invoices, makes payments and reconciling statements, prepares adjustments on journals and ensures monthly deadlines are met.

qualifications: O’ Levels Science; water ops cert (adv.)

description: This refers to an employees who, under supervision is responsible for the care and welfare of residents in an institution and for general cleanliness, hygiene and the supervision of staff and the smooth running of the institution who deputizes the housekeeper.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for cleaning offices, windows and sweeping floors of grounds daily.

This refers to an employee with formal training or appropriate experience engaged in cataloguing, classification of books filing and keeping the library and its collection of books and materials in good order, under supervision.

titles: Nursery School Teacher (Ministry Of Education Trained)

description: This refers to an employee who assists in the accounting operations under the supervision of an Accountant.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for professional handling of all finances for educational institutions, submitting returns and the preparation of all books for audit.

This refers to an employee who is engaged in the operation and manitenance of boilers which produce steam, including monitoring of high pressures and temperatures in accordance with safety requirements.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for caring and attending to the daily needs of poultry and livestock and carries out other related duties.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for running the company premises or clinic and is responsible for treatment of the sick and gives advice to both workers and management on hea;th issues, including safety awareness and those employed in the hospitals to provide quality general nursing care to patients as well as to check and restock emergency drugs and equipment.
This refers to an employee who assists in the preparation of meals, under supervision, and is capable of acting as a cook when necessary.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for planning, coordinating and controlling all catering activities and supervising all catering staff.
This refers to an employee who is engaged in the preparation of meals following written instructions, coordinating other kitchen activities and the supervision of junior staff.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for teaching computers to students under supervision.

qualifications: EMT/AT Cert; CPC/first aid; class 2 license (adv.)
description: This refers to an employee who is responsible for the provision of institutional ambulance services to clients.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for assisting the electrician with routine maintenance and repairs on all electrical appliances, pumps, switchgear and cables. They assist the electrician to erect overhead electrical cables and or install new armored cables.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for the collection, preparation and administering of claim forms to enable the collection of the organization's funds.

qualifications: Diploma Degree relevant field; driver’s license
description: This refers to an employee who provides effective community mobilisation, carries out needs assessment, training and provides project selection and extension services during project implementation in given areas.
This refers to an employee who deputizes the Cleaning Supervisor in supervising all general workers employed by an organization to carry out cleaning and grounds maintenance work.
This refers to an employee who deputizes for the supervisor in all aspects of supervision.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for receipting of drungs bougt over the counter, food supplied, telephone bills etc. and all debtors payments, then processes the retail accounts and follow up R.D cheques while preparing banking on a daily basis.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for supervising all general workers employed by an organization to carry out cleaning and ground maintenance duties

This refers to an employee who is responsible for ensuring that the warehouse has proper accounting and reporting systems in place to effectively support management decisions in accordance with donar requirements.

This refers to an employee who provides carpentry services to the organization who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skilled worker Class IV in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02].
This refers to an employee who is responsible for receiving incoming cash, recipting and banking.
This refers to an employee with no special qualifications who assists special school teachers, but who does not conduct any educational programs in a special care class or school.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for ensuring that patients' information is correct and accurate and gives correct notes for the doctor and also advises patients on issues of nutrition, and health.
This refers to an employee engaged in the inspection and well-being of animals.

This refers to an employee who generally maintains the cleanliness of an art room and assists in the preparation of all forms of art and craft material, including the mixing of paints, washing of brushes and other items under supervision.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for assisting the builder with any building and masonry work. The employee assists in carrying out general maintenance and repairs as well as construction of new brick/mortar structures as directed.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for assisting the carpenter in carrying out any carpentry work. The employee assists the carpenter to carry out general maintenance and repairs as well as construction of simple wooden structures as directed. The incumbent assists in carrying out carpentry work on institutions property such as doors, chairs, desks, tables as well as roofing and ceiling.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for assisting the painter with any paintwork. The employee assists in the painting of any old or new building and any other paint work as instructed.
This refers to an employee who is fully conversant with and mainly engaged in the preparation of different confectionaries, but may also be involved in the prepartion of other foods.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for the conduct, discipline and welfare of student in a boarding school.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for the binding of books, including the operation of binding machinery and ensuring quality standards are met.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for maintaining accurate financial records, including processing transactions and reconciling accounts.
This refers to an employee who operates and maintains a brush cutting machine, cutting grass and weeds on the grounds, pathways and fence lines.

This refers to an employee who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skilled worker Class I in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02]. They are responsible for overseeing construction projects, ensuring they are completed on time and to specifications.

This refers to an employee who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skilled worker Class II in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02]. They are responsible for assisting in construction projects, ensuring they are completed on time and to specifications.

This refers to an employee who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skilled worker Class III in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02]. They are responsible for assisting in construction projects, ensuring they are completed on time and to specifications.

This refers to an employee who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skilled worker Class IV in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02]. They are responsible for assisting in construction projects, ensuring they are completed on time and to specifications.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for purchasing of materials for use at an institution.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for weaving baskets and chairs.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for the care and safety of the employer's properties and premises.

This refers to an employee who provides carpentry services to the organization who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skilled worker Class I in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02].

This refers to an employee who provides carpentry services to the organization who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skilled worker Class II in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02].

This refers to an employee who provides carpentry services to the organization who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skilled worker Class III in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02].
This refers to an employee who operates a chainsaw, cuts trees/wood as required, cleans and maintains the machine.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for making chalk.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for providing and repairing all leather work outfits.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for directing visitors to building and records the times of their entries and exits therefrom.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for assisting students with speech challenges.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for the ultimate granting of credit facilities and the collection of outstanding debts.

qualifications: Science O’ Levels; Lab assistant cert (adv.)

description: This refers to an employee who is responsible for enforcing company security regulations, organizes trains, supervises and administers company internal security force.

qualifications: Class 2/4 license; defensive driving; first aid
